result.execSummary:
The defendant Demetrius W Rowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Demetrius W Rowe is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Demetrius W Rowe was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Demetrius W Rowe was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: EACH COUNT:  All costs, assessments and surcharges to be paid during ES in 15CF819.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts one and two of 15CF819.  Credit for 230 days.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count three and with counts one and two of 15CF819.  Credit for 230 days.

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant re:  sentence credit.  (Demetrius Rowe - #408150, Wisconsin Resource Center, PO Box 220, Winnebago WI 54985).

DECISION AND ORDER DENYING MOTION FOR POSTCONVICTION RELIEF; signed, filed, and distributed. Clerk mailed copy to Defendant.
THEREFORE, IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the Defendant's Motion for Postconviction Relief is DENIED.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. David Feiss, Br. 46, calendar successor, for review. mag

Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.
As to count 3:    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, concurrent with counts 1 and 2 of 15CF819 with credit for 230 days time served. 
As to count 4:    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, concurrent with count 3 and with counts 1 and 2 of 15CF819 with credit for 230 days time served. 
The court orders all costs, assessments and surcharges to be paid during ES in 15CF819.
Defendant is remanded.
Presentence Investigation Report, received and filed.   mld
Presentence Investigation Report, received and filed.   mld

Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-18-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Attorney Avery L Goodrich in court, defendant Demetrius W Rowe not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Parties have not had sufficient time to review the PSI.  Court will grant adjournment of sentencing hearing.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 4.

Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea to be entered by defendant.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered dismissal of COUNTS #1 and #2.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered both the repeater and while armed enhancers dismissed on COUNTS #3 and #4.

AS TO COUNTS #3 and #4 (without the repeater and while armed enhancer), Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  On both the motion of the State and defense counsel, Court ordered a Presentence Investigation without recommendation.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-2-2015 at 8:30 am.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED pending sentencing.   mld

Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
P.M. 
Jury in box.  Sworn for the State: Continued testimony of Milwaukee County DA Investigator Carl Buschmann on cross examination.  Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily agreed to testify.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Sworn for Defense: Demetrious Rowe (defendant).  Jury out of the box.  Settlement was discussed by parties.  No settlement reached by parties.  Court ordered Jury Trial continued in Branch 4 on 4-16-2015 at 10:00 am.    mld

Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
A.M.
Trial continued.  Jury in box.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Officer Kenton Burtch and Milwaukee Police Officer Miles Kowalik.  Exhibits 8 through 17 received.  Exhibits 8 through 17 is published to the jury.  Jury out of the box.  Jury in the box.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee County DA Investigator Carl Buschmann.  Exhibit 18 received.  Jury out of the box.  Jury in the box.  Trial resumed with previously sworn: Carl Buschmann on direct examination.  Exhibits 20 and 21 were played in open court.  Jury out of the box.  Exhibits 19, 20 and 21 received.  Stipulation placed on the record.  Court recessed for lunch.   mld
Warrant for witness Monica H. cancelled as witness appeared.

Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn for the State:  Claire Zellmer.  Exhibits 3-7 offered and received.  Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer James McNichols.  At the hour of 4:30 p.m., Court recesses matter until April 15, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.

Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Opening statements concluded. Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in court with attorney Joshua D. Uller.  Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel advised the Court that due to a conflict with another client, that he will need to withdraw as counsel on the case.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw is heard and granted by the Court.  Attorney Uller is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for Status of Counsel in Branch 4 on 2-12-2015 at 8:30 am.  Court maintains the Jury Trial date of 4-13-2015 at 8:30 am.  Court vacates the Final Pretrial Conference date of 3-24-2015 at 1:30 pm, Branch 4.   mld

from Attorney Joshua Uller for defense, received and filed.
- Motion Hearing scheduled for 1-27-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 4.   mld

Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in court with attorney Joshua D. Uller.  Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of the judgment of conviction attached for case 2008CF1724.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Myles Kowalik.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss without argument heard and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  State to file Amended Information, to correct repeater enhancer language.  Defense does not object to Amended Information.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  Available discovery was provided to defense counsel, per the State.  Additional discovery will be forthcoming to defense counsel, per the State.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-24-2015 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 4-13-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued until further order of the Court.   mld

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Monica H.; Rhonda H.; Elijah L. or D.R. (8 months old)

Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 3 & 4.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
